model

Class Day

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Day
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Day
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a single day, which contains various important information about the day, including date, day (of the week), events, and the month the day is in. This uses the Month, Week, YEar, and Event classes to model a day, as well as CalendarView in order to allow the view to access the Day to present visually.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Day(int i, int date, java.lang.String month)
      This is the primary constructor that creates a day object, also initiating an empty list of events for that day.
      Day(int day, int date, java.lang.String month, java.util.List<Event> events)
      This is another constructor that does all of the above, with the added functionality of setting a list of events to be the day's events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Day

        public Day(int i,
           int date,
           java.lang.String month)
        This is the primary constructor that creates a day object, also initiating an empty list of events for that day.
        Parameters:
        i - The given day of the week
        date - The given date
        month - The given month that the day is in This method sets all of the fields that are given as parameters, along with setting the view as an observer and creating an empty arraylist of events to set as the Day's events

      • Day

        public Day(int day,
           int date,
           java.lang.String month,
           java.util.List<Event> events)
        This is another constructor that does all of the above, with the added functionality of setting a list of events to be the day's events.
        Parameters:
        day - The given day of the week
        date - The given date
        month - The given month that the day is in
        events - The given list of events to set as the day's events This method does everything the above constructor does (minus setting the view as an Observer) as well as taking in a list of events to set as the Day's events

    • Method Detail

      • getEvents

        public java.util.List<Event> getEvents()
        Returns the day's events
        Returns:
        the list of events Does exactly what it says, simple getter

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(Event event)
        Adds the given event to the events list of the day, returns false if the event already exists
        Parameters:
        event - The event to add
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the event is able to be added or not This method takes in an Event object to add to the Day's list of events and adds it to the list, then sorts the event list based on start time. The Day is then set as changed and observing objects are notified. True is returned if added successfully (if the event wasn't already in the list of events)

      • setEvents

        public void setEvents(java.util.List<Event> events)
        This method sets the events to the passed in list of events
        Parameters:
        events - The new events list to set as the Day's events This method sets the list of events to the passed in list of events by making a deep copy, then the Day is set as changed and observers are notified.

      • getDay

        public java.lang.String getDay()
        Returns the day of the week of the day object
        Returns:
        a string indicating day of the week This method uses a switch case and the day field to figure out what word day of the week corresponds to the Day object's day of the week integer, and it returns the int.

      • setDay

        public void setDay(int day)
        This sets the current day of the week to the passed in day
        Parameters:
        day - The new day of the week to attribute to the day This method takes in an integer representing the day of the week and sets the day as changed as well as notifying observers.

      • getMonth

        public java.lang.String getMonth()
        Returns the month that the day is in
        Returns:
        a string indicating the month This is a simple getter that returns the month name the day is in.

      • setMonth

        public void setMonth(java.lang.String month)
        Sets the month the Day is in to the new passed in month
        Parameters:
        month - The new month the day is in This method sets the month the day is in to the passed in month, sets the Day as changed, and notifies the observers.

      • getDate

        public int getDate()
        Returns the day's date
        Returns:
        int indicating the date This simply gets the int date of the Day

      • setDate

        public void setDate(int date)
        Sets the Day's date to the new passed in date
        Parameters:
        date - The new date for the Day object This takes in an int date and sets the Day's date to the int, sets the Day as changed, and notifies the observers.
